titleStmt.author: Carmichael, Alexander Archibald (1832‐1912)
titleStmt.sponsor: Edinburgh University Library and the Department of Scottish and Celtic Studies

interpretation.p: All digital surrogates of the original source are linked with the markup textfile.
All Gaelic (and English) texts have an English summary, index terms, keywords, and, where applicable, a taxonomic reference.
For some Gaelic (and English) texts a bibliographic reference(s) will be provided to other sources.

correction.p: Errors from the original source transcription have been kept to a minimum by employing stringent quality control procedures. In addition, all texts have been proof‐read by the text editors.

A guiding principle of the Alexander Carmichael notebooks markup procedure is to approximate the original document as closely as possible, so that the character of Carmichael's transcriptions is preserved along with its content. XML (eXtensible Markup Language), with its capacity to convey emendations such as deletions (crossed out) and supralinear additions and so forth, can digitally reproduce an authentic version which reflects the source documents.
Where authorial changes, e.g. substitution, have occurred in the text then this has been annotated.
Where there are errors they have been corrected and words which were difficulty to decipher has been indicated

In such cases missing words or letters have been supplied. Quotation marks and other missing grammatical marks have in the main not been supplied. Where there are gaps in the text usually because the word was inaudible (some background noise, perhaps) or where the transcriber could not make out what was being said in the act of transcription (perhaps the speaker was inarticulate or mumbling or for whatever reason) then these have been tagged, though not explained; where a word is now difficult, illegible or just unclear, then this has also been tagged.
All such changes have been annotated in accordance with TEI 5 procedures.

normalization.p: No normalization of the words such as changing the source text to conform with current Gaelic orthographic conventions has been undertaken. The texts are as given with only minor editorial changes. in order to preserve the integrity of the original texts.

quotation.p: All opening quotation marks, hyphens, dashes, apostrophes, periods, colons, etc. have been retained in the source text and have been encoded in accodance with ISO entity references, etc.
All double marks have been processed using straight quotation marks, that is, ". All single quotation marks have been rendered using apostrophe.

hyphenation.p: End‐of‐line hyphenation has been retained. All unambiguous end‐of‐line hyphens have been retained, and the trailing part of a word has not been joined to the preceding line.of‐line hyphenation has been retained. All unambiguous end‐of‐line hyphens have been retained, and the trailing part of a word has not been joined to the preceding line.

segmentation.p: Folio numbers have been added in pencil at the top of each notebook page are retained using the pb (pagebreak) element together with the n attribute for the page number and the ed attribute to specify the edition.
When an tale‐text or song which, more often than not, fills more than one page, it is segmented with page break.

langUsage.language: Approximately 40% of the fieldnote and transcription bokos are Scottish Gaelic, and the remaining 60% consist of English or Scots, along with stray quotations in Latin.

div.title: Notes.
div.p:
Left Lochmaddy about 6 pm
18 DcDecember 651865.

An Ord. Ionnar anlavaig now
Ionnarahlaigidh. Two stone coffins
found there in the sumsummer of '641864. There
is a rock in the bay at the end
of which there is a stone Clach
ullain. Eilean-Ruridh is an island
about two hundred yards out opposite
Dun Sgathaich. There is the appearance
of old ruins there. A quantity of cinders
a is about the ruins. Probably a smithy
was there. There is a rock on the plain
three or four hundred yards from Dun
Sgāthaich at the end of which there
is a large b oblong called Clach ullain
The whole of the side of Skye on which
the Dun is is called Leir-DunsgathaicLeir-Dunsgathaich
"Dunsgathaich view". I met one woman
only who repeated me some lines of
Duan Chonnlaoich. Urns were
found about the old Dun contaning
ashes supposed to have been the ashes
of some of the Feinne. There is a
drawbridge to the old fort, and a wind-
ing staircase leading up to the Dun.
The parapet of the stair is full of
loopholes for shooting arrows. The
bridge and stair however do not seem
so old as the Dun. The lime is shells
and the sand is very rough. There is a
hatch on the passage leading to the stair
like that on board a ship. The sgullsskulls
found in the graves were carried off
by some tourists to EdinEdinburgh Dun is
almost oppoisteopposite Uamh an oir in
Strath-aird – Sparr cave.

The Dun is on an island. The sea
can only surround it at very high
tides. The On the island opposite
the Dun was perhaps the armoury
attached to the college. The inside looked
to me as if it contained houses of a later
age than the Dun itself.

Armidale Castle. Fine pannledpanneled winwindows
but not Highland in appearance. Figure
Somerled. Saw spinning wheel in the
drawing-room. The HonHonorable Miss Mac
Donald is a fine specimen of a High
land lady, elegant as a swan gentle as
a dove and brave as a lion.

Cillmhor – "large cell". There is a very
handsome marble monument
in the church to the memory of Sir
James MacDonald who died in Rome.

New Year 1866
Callanish – about 50 stones. One
about 16 or 18 ftfeet high. Like an Iona X.
From the North an avenue. In the mi
middle of the circle and with in this again
an altar from which there is a running drain
Rough diagram of stones The people call the stones "Na
Tursachan", "na Fir bhreige" &c
They make out that they can not be
counted. There is another circle about
halfway between the Callanish stones
and Gearradh na h abhine. It is a
circle within a circle containing 150
There is another at some miles
distance but not so large.

There is another place call at
Grimartaidh called Taigh nan DruieanDruidhean

There is also another place within two
miles of Storn.Stornoway in which there are several
circles called Gleann sagairt.
These are mounds and stand.

Paraffin works About 13 hundred irons of peats
are cut in Summer. These are brought
to the works by canal boats and trucks
laid on rails. There are put into re
torts of which there are

standing stones within. There is a
Tormad MacLeoid at who knows
a good deal about these old things. He
is a poet and a man of excellent me-
mory. I met a man at TolstaiTolstaidh
who said that he saw no difference be-
tween the FFree and EEstablished church but that
the latter gave the com.communion to doubtful
characters. The ministers in the
LLong Island will not marry a couple
till they first promise to have no
dancing nor whisky – rather
tyranicaltyrannical. The Dun-more, Dun
at Carlaway is the perhaps the
most perfect in these isles. Till within a
few years ago it stood perfect. Then
a man who was building a house for
himself thought he should like some
of the stones in the Dun. The most
perfect of the lake forts is one at .
It is a square building with two of
its sides still up.

Moladh Ghoill le Fionn
Le DonulDomhnull Mac a Phie gobha
Breubhaig Barraidh MarMarch 14 1867

Treis nan ton eir ghaisge ghrinn
Leon mac agh crotha na ghniomh

Prontach a ghair conthach a threoir
Fhuant a min mileanta mor.
Fear dauchail caomh nach treig a dhaimh
Su coga righ nach lag a lamh

div.p:
Duan an Deirg
Le DonulDomhnull Mac a Phie Gobha
Breubhaig Barraidh MarMarch 14 1867

Se an Dearg mor mac Drui bheuil
a thuite ri athair Choinn. Bha
e tamh 'san Eilean Sgitheanach
agus thog e eir gus an Fheinn
Mharbh an Fheinn e agus nuair
bha Conn coig bliannabliadhna fichead
togar eir a thoirt mach torractorrachd
athair agus rainigear an Fheinn

Bha e anaanabarrach geilidh mor laidir
agus cha rorobh fios aig an Fheinn
ceumar a chuirt as da. Chuir
iad a sin Caoilte (Daorghlas) eir
falbh a Eirinn an Eilean Sgith-
eanach gus faighinn a mach
gu de bu bhas o chonn. Thainig
e gu mathair Choinn agus
a phiuthar (cha rorobh ann ach Conn Transcribed
April 30 1869
agus aon phiuthar) Coia as thaine
an laoch ars mathair Chionn
as a leithid so a dh-aite an
Eirinn ars ea Coinnaoilte. An ta dh-
falbhdh-fhalbh diulaoch mor as a so
a sin – am fac thu – Conn
Mac an Deirg? Chunna
mi ach mu chunna cha nchan
fhaice sibhse tuillituillidh e." Carson
sin – co mharbh e? Mharbh an
Fhinn. An ta ars a mhathair
nan cumta ol us mnathun
bho Choinn mor mo mhacsa cha
rorobh 'san Fhinn na mharbh-
adh e. Shin Caoilt as gu
an Eirinn. Rinneadh bāl
an deigh bal agus thugadh ol
us mnathun eir an oicheoidhche agus
cluich ann eir an lalatha do Chonn
gus na mharbhadh e. Bha
Fionn a leitheas chreuc Ghoill
a chuile h-oicheh-oidhche agus cha rorobh
duine toirt lamh eir bonn
Thatar a radh gur h-ann bho
bhonn so – Conn ceud chat
achchathach – a thainig na Donullach

div.p:
Heard this from Eachun Mac
Neil a blind man who lived in Mac
Neil of Barra's house as musa
musician and historian. Hector
MacNeil was a big powerful man
and considered the best fiddler in
Scotland. He married when he
was considerably past 80 years
He had £200 saved from his
salary. Had no family.

Camhail Fhinn eir Oscar
Le DonulDomhnull Mac a' Phi gobhain
Breuvaig BarraiBarraidh March 14 1867.

div.add:
Heard this from Nial MacAonaisMacAonghais
an Cille-Bharra, coitear. He was a
capital reciter. This man's father
was the best reciter and piper of his
day.

div.p:
OicheOidhche rinn Fionn cuirm mhor
ga chuid cuideaccuideachd thainig sean
duine (athach) an rathad. Agus ghabh e
suas agus shuishuidh ri gual.gualain deis FhFhinn
gun chuir.chuireadh gun fhiach.fiathachadh sam bith.
Nuair a chun.chunna Conan gun rorobh e
Cho lad.ladarna mhi mheilmhi mhoghail ghabh e suas
agus buail.buaileadh an t-athach. Anns
a mhionaid an do bhuail e e thion.thionndaidh
Fionn ris an athach agus dh-fhaighdh-fhaighnich
e de 'n duine bh ann no co 'n
duine e. Is mise teach.teachdaire arsa an t abh
ach a thainig o Righ Lochlann
Beir. sibh eir ConConan ars a Fionn
agus cuir an toll dughdubh dorach e
a chionn a chu bhi aig teac.teachdaire RiRigh
LochLochlann a bhual.bhualadh Rug eir ConConan agus
chuirchuireadh san toll e a reir ordan
Fheinn agus cha rorobh e ri tightighinn as
a sidsiod gus an rachrachadh a chuirm
seachad. So nuair thoisthoisich an t-
athach ri inseadhinnseadh gu de an teacteachdaireachd
ma'na chuir e. Riamh o'n chiad
bhlian.bhliadhna a bha sibhse an LochLochlann an
tois.toiseach ghabh nighean R.Righ L.Lochlann gaol ort
FhFhinn agus tha i an trast air choltas
bhi {eir {march leabaileabaidh a bais gad chumha
Chuir a h-athair mismise eir theac.theachaireachd gad
d-iond-ionnsaidh air son thu dhol do L.Lochlann
thu fhein & do chuic.cuideachd agus gun
ceanla sibh cocl co chea'alcheangal
sibh agus nach biodh dad ann
a mach uaiuaith so tuile. Bhuil
falbhfalbhaidh sinne cocomhla riut ors Fionn
Rinn iad a so deiseil eir son
falbh agus iad an deideigh iad fhein
a bheirteach nan eideadh. Am
bheil thu idir ors a Goll ag ord-
achadh dhuindhuinn airm a thoirt
leinn. Cha d-falbhd-fhalbhsinn o'n taigh
riamh gun airm. Chan eil ors
FFionn bhiodh e ro nar dhuinn falbh
a chea'alcheangal sith ri RiRigh LLochlann fo airm
ann Cha fhreag.fhreagair sin idir.
Ach so an rud a ni sin bheir
sinn leinn sgianun fo ar crios-
un dhion faodfaodaidh sinn am fal-
ach agus cha'n fhaicear ag.
iad agus ma bhios feum ors
e fhearr dhuinn ag iad na ar
lamhan. Bheut. iad cad fhefhein
gu surdail le'n cuid fheile
gu h ard gluineach.

Thuirt Caoilte agus iad
a caitheamh na cuirme nach
bith cea ailtceangailte a sidsiod na b fhaide
agus dh-fhuasgail e gun ordan
Fheinn idir e agus gun fhios
nach e CConan a bha ceart agus nach
be an t-athach.

Rainig iad a so LLochlann agus an t-
athach na fhear iuil ac thug e
gu taigh mor fad iad coltach
ri taigh aoraidh agus dorust
eir a cheann. Nuair chaichaidh iad
a stigh a so bha lan sluaisluaigh a
taigh rompa. Bha bord mor
a sin bho'n dal ceancheann gus an
ruig. e an ceanceann eile eir a shuishuidh

Thois.Thoisich an t athach a so ri n
cuir nan suisuidh agus se 'n doidoigh
cuir nan suisuidh bha aige nuair
chuir e fear dhiusan na shuishuidh
chuir e distdithist LochLochlannach ri thaothaobh. Bha
mar so distdithist eir taotaobh a chuile
fear a chuid.chuideachd Fheinn. Nist bha
iad a nis nan sui.suidh Cha rorobh lamh
ri chuir eir ni bha eir a bhord
gus an tigh Righ agus BBanrighinn an
tightighinn LochLochlannach is taigha-staigh. Thainig iad
a sin is taigha-staigh agus an nighnighean
eadora. Sin nuair chunchunnaic F.Fionn
gun tainig iad a is taigh dh-
eirich e na sheas.sheasamh gus failte
chur eir orra. Dean stad beag
Fhinn ors RRigh LLochlann tha beagan
cheist ag.agam ri chur ort mun cuircuireas
mi failte sam bith ort.

Cait an d' fhag sibh a mo mhac
a leithid so a dh fhear ars R.Righ L.Lochlann
agus fear an deideigh fir dh-aimn
naoinear gus an tainig e gus
am fear mu dheireadh Sin
thu Bha chuile fear a mharbh
iad a freagairt Ma righ LochLochlann
agus thuirt Oscar Cait an
d-fhag sibh Gormal Gonn-
alach mo mhac. Dh fhag
mise e ors Oscar eir Traigh-
Chliabhain mu thuath
Far na thuirt do mhor shluashluagh
Gun taing do dhuin ag ga chionn
A dh-fhas riamh an riogh LochLochlann

Sin mar dh-ain.dh-aithnich Fionn
gun rorobh an t-sabaid gu bhibhith ann
agus thuirt e -

Na am bith ann am ghobha
Smath dhean.dheannain sgeum
Chur cruaicruaidh nan saithean
Chuir sionn nan raoinean
Ch.Chuir casun fraoich le a crun bhuibhuaidh
Ann an cuil thuigha nam fa'orfaobhar tana
Thois. a sin Nuair thain.thainig Righ
LLochlann is taigha-staigh agus a dhiult e lamh
do dh-Fhinn thuirt FFionn Cait am
bheil na mionun mor a Mhain?
Dh fhagus far an d-fhuaras.

Bha Fionn an cuil le nigh.nighean
Righ LLochlann bha cacha cuir
a mach nanna LLochlannaich e fhein
agus ise a briodal ri cheile
Thug Fionn leis i agus bha i
fad bliannabliadhna aige san Fheinn.

Bha ghlac ach an FhFheinn as
Cor agus leth ar FFionn
Thuit sidsiod air an t-sliabhun dheas
Ach nan luaidhmid a ghrian
Chan mhu na ar tuan thainig as
Ach nan luaidhmid a ghrian

Tuiteam eir gach taotaobh dha bord
Shorachar mic Uisnich sa ghreis
Mar thri galain fas cho deas
Eir an sgrios le doinion E eitidh
S cha dh-fagdh-fhag meangan nuas no geug dhiudhiubh
{Ghluais{Righ ConConochar a Dhear.Dhearduil as do luing
A gheug ar an fhuara dhuinn
A cha'n eagal dha d ghnuis ghlain
Fuath no eud no achasan
Cha teid mi mach as mo loing
Gus am faigh mi mo raogha achuig
Cha tir 's cha talatalamh s cha tuar
S cha triuir bhrathreanbraithrean bu ghlan snuagh
Cha'n or s cha'n airgiod s cha'n eich
Na's mu is bean uaireach mis
Ach mo chead a dhol dhan traitraigh
Far am bheil ClanClann Uisne nan tamh
S gun tugaintugainn na tri poga meala
Dha'n tri corpun caoine geala
Ghluais Dear.Dearduil s in dha'n traitraigh
Us fhuair i saor a snaithe ramh
Sgian aige na le laimh
Sa thuagh aige na laimh eile
A shaoir is s fherr gam facas riamh
Gu de eir na tug a'n sgian
Se bh0eir dhuit ga cionn
Aon fhaine bua'achbuadhach na h-Eirionn
Shanntaich a saor a faine
Eir dheisead agus eir ailleacailleachd
Us thug e do Dh-ear. an sgian
Us rainig i ionad a ruiann
Cha gharr gun ChlanChlann Uisne
O's turach gun bhi nar cualach
Tri mic righ le'n dioitle dhoire
Tha gun choradh ri ucuchd uagha
Tri mathanun InseInnse BreatunBreatuinn
An triuir sheo'agsheobhag a shliabh a Chuillinn
An triuir dha'n geil na gaisgich
S dh'ndha'n tug h-amhais anam.
Na tri eoin a b aillib aillidh snuagh
A thain.thainig eir chuan nam barc
Mar thruir eal eir truinn s snamh
Theid mise gu h-aoi'neachh-aoibhneach ulaodh
Fo'n triuir churaichuraidh a h-annsa
Mo sha'olshaoghal nan deideigh cha'n fhada
lg.add:
Mathan mathanan = Math-gamhuin
InseInnse Breithtean = Britain
lg.l: Us chan eug eir feara-bhuaith dhomhsa
Tri iallan nan tri chon sin
So bhuin osan o'm chrichridh
Sann agams a bhiodh an tasgaitasgaidh
Ga faicinn an saor cumha
A chlann Uisne tha sid thall
Nar laidhe bonn ri bonn
Na saimh laichibh marbh ro bheo eile
S amhlaichibh sibhse romhamsa.

div.p:
Chuala DonulDomhnull Mac a Bhīth
an laoilaoidh so aig Eachunn mac
Neill – dall – an Eoligearry. Bha
40 bliadhna roimhe so.

Tha sgialacsgialachd eir a so cuideachcuideachd
Bhiodh Ardan agam ri teireart
Us Aillein ri seilg shlei'teanshleibhtean
S bhiodh Naois na cheann eir muintirmuinntir

Trillseir = slios na luing. Einnich =
Meinn, mogh. Faūra = Ruisg agus mail
ean nan sul. Cualach = A heap
Teann a null a Naoise mo ghraighraidh
Us duireadh Ardan ri Aillein
Nam biodh ciall aig marbh
DheanDheanadh iad aite dhomhsa.

Each-draiEach-draidh Chlann Uisne
Le Iain MacNeil coitear am
Buaile nam bodach. aois 83 co-
aois a Chorneil mhicNeil.
He appears about 60 years. Di-Sathuirne MarMarch 16, 1867.

Bha fear ann an EirEireann a sidsiod ris
an can iad Gollam Colum Cruitire agus
bha e na dhuine coir agus rudrudeigin math
a chuid an t-saoghail aige. Agus
cha rorobh duine sliocsliochd riamh aige.
Rainig e fhein agus a bhean
aois ghad a mhor eir alt as
nach rorobh suil aca ri duine sliocsliochd
Gu de chual iad ach gun rorobh
fiosaiche anns an aite agus
bha an duine na duine taittaitneach eir
alt agus gun rorobh uighuidh eige am fios
thigh goirid da. Ga be dhiudhiubh chuir
e brath eir no thainig am fios leis
fhein thainig e thun taigh Gholl
ann Chuiritire. Dh fhaiDh fhaighneachd Goll Gu
an fhios an rorobh e deandeanamh fiosfiosachd Thuirt
am fiosfiosaiche gun rorobh e deandeanamh beagan
an rorobh fios uaithsan no an
rorobh toite aige fios fhaotfhaotainn Am bheil
thu deandeanamh fiosfiosachd no an dean thu fiosfiosachd dhomh
Mata ni ars am fiosfiosaiche Gu de an fhiosfhiosachd
tha dhidhith ort? Tha fiosfiosachd uambhuam sibh a
dh insdh innis dhomh gu de tha ri eireirigh
dhomh no am faod sibh fiosrach
a thoirt dhomh eir. An ta ors
easan tha mismise dol a mach as
an taigh agus bith fhios muair
thig mi stigh agus cuircuiridh mi
ceut ort mu dheighdheighinn rud agus
Dh-fhalbh am fiosfiosaiche a mach agus
cha b fhada bha e muigh nuair thaigthainig
e stigh. An rorobh sliocsliochd riamh agad
ors esan ri GolGoll CruitCruitire. An ta
chan eil ors GGoll CCruitire chan neil sliocsliochd
agam idir ach na bheil a so.
mi fhein agus mo bhean. Mata
ars am fiosfiosaiche tha sin neonach liom
fhefhein agus mi faotfaotainn ann an fhiosfhiosachd
gur h-ann mu nighnighean duit a
dhoirtear am fhuil is mu dhoirt
ardhoirtear EirEireann riamh bho chionn an
urraduiread so chunntas bhlianbhliadhna agus
ars esaesan ni tri olaich cho ainm
eil agus bha riamh ri fhaotfhaotainn gun
teid iad an call ri linn. An
e sin fiosfiosachd tha thu dol a dheandheanamh
dhomh ors GGoll CCruitire agus e a saoilsaoilsinn
gur h ann bha am fiosfiosaiche a fanfanaid eir
Se ors easeasan An ta ors GGoll CCruitire
mas e sin fiosfiosachd tha thu dol a dheandheanamh
dhomh faotfaotaoidh tu ga'ailgabhail rathad
eile cha mhor is fhiach thu
fhefhein no d-fhiosd-fhiosachd an ta N ars
am fiosfiosaiche tha mise gad dheardhearbhadh
cuntcunntais as a sidsiod tha mise faicfaicinn
sidsiod gle chintchinnteach am intininntinn fhein
Mata ors easeasan chan urrainurrainn sin
cinneachadh chan eil e com
gum bi duine sliocsliochd agams
no aige an te th agam gu brach.
Rainig mi fhin agus ise aois
mhoir eir chor agus nach ururrainn
duine sliocsliochd bhibhith agagam gu brachbrath

Chan eil mise dol a dhil d fhua
ort chan eil dad do gnothach
agam rithe agus ach sidsiod an
rud tha cinntcinnteach – nach rorobh
agus nach bi sliocsliochd agam no aig
an te bh agagam gu brachbrath.

Ach tuitthuit dha fhiosfhiosaiche cha 'n iarr
s cha ghaghabh GGoll CruitCruitire on a rinn e
an fhiosfhiosachd nach rorobh colt Agus ligleig
e eir falbh am fiosfiosaiche co dhiudhiubh thug
e baitse (paigheadh) s na nach tugtugadh
dh-fhalbh am fiosfiosaiche cha be sin a
dh ailisdh ailios eir an sgeul ach ga
b-ar bith uine anns an d-falbhd-fhalbh
fios thoisthoisich a chailchailleach ri fas le-tromachleth-tromach
agus eir an imeacimeachd gum bu choir
dhi tightighinn bha GGoll CruitCruitire a fad an
confusion nach d-rinn e an
tuit sean ris an fhiosfhiosaiche. Agus bha e
fo smaoin agus fo thriobthrioblaid a so
nach rorobh ann fhefhein ach duine gun doidoigh
agus gun dad do thacs aige agus
nan tigtigeadh a leidleithid sidsiod do thurlach
eir rud a bha mi coltach gun
tigtigeadh leis mar abha e an aghaiaghaidh a
ghnothghnothach an toistoiseach gun rorobh e ion
'sa bhi cintcinnteach gun tigtigeadh e gu crich. Bha
fo smaoinsmaoinich e trom gad b ann eir a
leabai e gun de an aona sheacsaod
a dheandheanamh gus an dortadh fala so
sheachnadh. Se smaoin a rinn
e nan cuir Ni-math an cur Dia nan duileacduileachd a
bha so eir aghartadhart thun an t saoilt saoghail
Agus so dh-fhas an sean bhoirbhoireannach
bocbochd eir an urra chaloine bha 'n a
so. Cha do leig e duine beo dhachdhachaidh
ag ach bhean ghluin a bha toirt
aire dhidhith agus e fhein. Chuir e cul
eir a bhoir.bhoireannach sin an ga'adhghabhadh e fhein
a mhentairt ris an leanleanabh a
chur a falfalach far nach fhaic suil
e. Thuirt am boirboireannach gun gaadhgabhadh.
ShuiShuidh e tiuir fhan agus chuir
e eir falbh iad gu ruig mona
mor fad o laimh gan fhios
gun fhair a dhuine sam bith
Thug e man ar croc cruinn a
a chladh as a bhraoin agus
a bhogsadh na is taigha-staigh eir chor
agus gun gaadhgabhadh beagan cuid
tamh ann. Ruig a sin nighnighean do
GhGholl CruitCruitire agus ga mhnaoi agus
chuir e fhein agus a a bheanbhean-ghluin
bha toirt aire an bhoirbhoireannach eir falbh
gu ruig am monmonadh mor fad o
lamh far an d-rinn ant aite
dhaint eir an ciunn. Agus
chuir lon lalatha agus bliannabliadhna leoleotha
agus gur h-ann ann ceanceann na
blianbliadhna reachreachadh tuil thuca. Gun
fhios sam bith a mhuinmhuinntir na
h-Eh-Eireann mun deighdeighinn na mu dheighdheighinn
dad sam bith a bhann gus
an rorobh Dearduil nighnighean GholGholl
Chruitire 14 blianbliadhna a dh-aois
Nach eil duine sam bith a sheal.sheall
anns an aodaodann orra nach de
sam bith cruthaccruidheachd eile bh aice
nach reachreachadh in a caoran dearg
fala ri linn a faic. Gu rorobh iad
am b aon bhoir.bhoireannach i bha ga faic nach
rorobh eadar grian agus talamh
aona bhoine falla bu bhoichebhoidhche na
i. Agus bha am boirboireannach bha bha na bun a
toirt a chuile fios a dh-fhaotdh-fhaotainn i dhi
ach nach rorobh i airson gu faic i
neach sam no neach sam bibith i.
Bha i creidsincreidsinn a chuile fios uapa
ach nach rorobh i faicfaicinn duine sam
bith a mhuinmhuinntir an t-saoght-saoghail. OicheOidhche
dhoineandhoinnean gharbh thainig duine
rathar an talla agus le blathas
an taighe smaointsmaointich e gu rorobh con
an taobh is taigha-staigh an chnoc.
GhlaoGhlaodh e sidsiod ma bha duine beo
is taigha-staigh iad ge leig a staigh as leth
Ni math. Thuirt am boirboireannach og ris an
t seant seann bhoirbhoireannach Gu deart bha sidsiod?
Thuirt an seanna bhoirbhoireannach nach
rorobh ach rud gun diu – nach ruig
ise lesleas a smaoinsmaoineachadh gun rorobh rud ann
bheirbheireadh toil dhisedhithse – nach rorobh ann
ach coin an athar. Thuirt
an seanseann bhoirbhoireannach bha muigh a sin
Ma tha duine beo a so nach leig
sibh is taigha-staigh mi as leth Ni math
O mhuime se ian tha sidsiod agus
e sirsireadh a leigleigeil as staigha-staigh as leth Ni
math agus tha thu fhein a glaodhglaodhadh
gum bhi bu choir rud a ghreag
a dh-iant na Ainmsan.
Mu Cha leig airs an seanseann bhoir.bhoireannach
Mar leig ars DearDearduil cha mhor
is fhiach dhomhs bhi leantail
do theagaisg Ach ors ise o'n a
tha mise creidcreidsinn an teagteagasg tha thus g
ionionnsachadh dhomh leig mi fhefhein staigh e
agus leig Dear.Dearduil is taigha-staigh an sean
duine. Thug i aite suidhe dha
nuair thainig e dhachaidhachaidh. Ran
Thug i biadh dha agus thug i
blaths dha. Gabh rudan bhiadh
a dhuine bhocbhochd agus tu riat-
anach eir. Bha mi riatriatanach agus
bha mi fios riatriatanach eir cuid nuair
thianig mi dhachdhachaidh ach nuair a
chunchunnaic mi d-aodsad-aodannsa dh-fhalbh
gach sgios is acras dhiom.
Gu de bhuthbhuaidh a thoirt ors a
chail.chailleach cha mhor a ni dhuit
do bhial a chumail duinte
ars an fasgar an treighe fhaotfhaotain
Faod.Faodaidh mise sin ars an t-aoit-aoidh
thainig dhachdhachaidh mo bhial a
chumchumail duinte ach nuair
faicfaicinn cuid eile mhuinmhuinntir an t saoght saoghail
i chan fhada dh-fhag iad agus
i. Gu de an fheothainfheadhainn tha sin
ors Deardaire no co iad. An ta
ars mise sin duitse. Tha Naois
ne mac Uisne agus Aillein agus
Ardan a bhraithean. Gu de coltas
nam fionach sin nam faic iad
ors Deardaire. Tha sidsiod agad
an ainm agus an sloin.sloinneadh na
fhuair mise orra agus ma chi
thu fhein iad fain. tu ristrithist ud
chan fhaic thu 'n leithid ach iad fhein
agus than a bheil os cionn crom
adh an da shlinein aig Naoisne
os cionn sluigh na h Eirinn uile
Ga bar bith mar tha iad ors
an sanseann bhoirbhoireannach bi thus a falbh
agus gu dearbh is beag mo chom
ruil a chionn tightighinn chun na far
daich so. Ach dh-fhalbh an seanseann
duine bha so bh uauapa agus dh fagdh fhag e
leoleotha fhein iad. Agus eir bheagan
an deideigh dha falbh smaoinsmaoinich e aige
fhine gu rorobh righ EirEireann leis fhein
gun bhean gun cheile agus nach
rorobh fhios nach fhaigh e duais uairuairean
nan insinnis e da gu rorobh leidleithid sidsiod do
bhoine fala eir an t-saoghal. ChaiChaidh
e far RainRainig e teolachteoghlach (taigh) an
Righ agus dh-fheordh-fheoraich e an rorobh Conachar
Righ Ulla is taigh. FhreagFhreagair righ na
h Eirh Eireann a agus chaiChaidh e mach a bhruithbhruitheann
ris agus dh-fhaiddh-fhaidhnich e gu de 'n gnothgnothach
a bh aige dhasan. Thuirt e ris gun
robh aona ghnothach ris gu
fac e an aona fala a b aillib aillidh eadeadar
grian an talamh agus ma bha
toil aige n ceile bu mhaisiche eir
an domhain fhaotfhaotainn gungum bu
choir dha dol ga faicfaicinn Cait am
bheil am boiboireannach sin nach rorobh i ri
faicfaicinn, an aite sam bibith gus am fac
thus i? Nam fac tus i. Gad a
chunachunna mis chan fhaic duine
eil gus am faigh e ion.ionnsachadh araid eir
a shon. Gus an teid thu fhein a
dh-iondh-ionnsachadh an ait tha sin no leig fhaicfhaicinn
a bhoirbhoireannach sin dhuinn? Theid ors
easeasan a righ mu an cead dar n-
onair mu gheogheobh mi duais
mhath eir a shon gad nach
bitear airson na teac.teachdaire dhomh
dhean Mata ors an righ fuirfuirich thus
san teol.teoghlach so agus am mairmaireach agus
falfalbhadh mismise agus mo bhuidhean
ghaisgghaisgeach fhein colacomhla riut agus
chi sinn ciamar bhios sin
Agus ors easeasan bith do dhuais
cho math rud shaoir mas
's e agus gu'n cord an gnothgnothach rium
Dh-fhuirDh-fhuirich an teacteachdaire an oicheoidhche sin ann an
teolteoghlach an righ. Chuir an righ a so
na daoine bu deamhail leis
fhein mar bha triuir mhac
Fhearachair ic Rō, clann bhrath.brathair
athair an ririgh fhein. Dh imich iad fhein agus
beagan sluaisluaigh eile colacomhla riuriutha agus an
teacteachdaire a bh aig leis a bhrathbhrathair eir an
ceann. Ghabh Rainig iad an
tultulach eir an so Deairdire eir a cur a
suas – e fhin agus a mhuime. Tha i
ann a sidsiod a nis ars an teacteachdaire anns
an talla ud agus thugthugadh fhein as i
cha'n eil mis dol nas fhaid no so
leibh. Ghabh righ EEireann dh-iondh-ionnsaidh dorus
an talla agus shir e fhosg.fhosgladh. Thuirt
an seanseann bhoirbhoireannach ris nach roasrobhas dol
a dh fhosdh fhosgladh an dorust gus am biodh
fios co bha g iarg iarraidh fos.fosgladh am

div.p:
La'uirLabhuir righ EirEireann a sin FosgFosgail tuis
an dordorus chan gu d-olcas a tha i
ach gu d mhath agus gheogheobh thu
talla 's fhearfhearr na sin so ri linn sinn
dhol dachdachaidh Cha 'n eil mi g iarriarraidh talla
's fhearfhearr na so mac dh-fhagar an
mi niar cinn neart righ no
rioghacrioghachd as mi chan eil mi
g iarriarraidh fhag An ta ors easeasan fag
tu e co dhiudhiubh agus feumfeumaidh tu fhagfhagail
agus mar fosgfosgail thus thu fhein i
fos sin sinn fhein e agus
thug thu as a dheoin no dh-aineoin
An ta ors ise nam bith sibh cho
math agus gun tug sibh dhomh
brath co tha sirsireadh FhosFhosglas math –
dh fhaoite gum bith na bu
deoin fhos na th ann Tha mi
ann a so mata righ EirEireann agus
na biodh sin ann an dalla-chran

add.p:
sloc deas thilgeadh ann triuir
chlann Uisne. Thuirt ise Tean-
nadh Naoise null leanadh Aillein
ri Ardan s nAm biodh ceall aig
marbh dheanadh sibh aite dhomhsa
Rinn iad sin agus nuair a
chunnaig ise an t-aite re leum
i sios ann us bha i marbh maill
riuriutha. Dh ordaich an droch Righ
a sin ise thogail as an t-sloc sa
tilgeil eir toah eiel an loch a
bha ri laimh. Rinneadh sin agus
dh-fasdh-fhas gathun githais as an
uaigh aicese agus g athun giuth
ais as an uaigh aigiesan agus
chuir an da ghath snaoim eir
a chuile os cionn an lochan.

div.p:
nach nacnachd ort tuiltuilleadh. Dh-eirDh-eirich a chailchailleach
nuair chual i so agus dh-fosdh-fhosgail i an
dordorus gu h-eah-ealamh do righ na EEireann – ChaiChaidh ririgh
na h Eah Eireann is staigha-staigh agus chunchunnaic e am
boirboireannach a bha g ian agus ghabh e
tlactlachd dhidhith nach do ghabh e do ni
dhun i de shuile corpara. Cha
rorobh fonear dhaibh o thoisthoiseach gu
deirdeireadh ach breith oirre fhein agus
eir a muine agus an toirt leoleoth
gu palas a righ. Cha rorobh dad sam
bith a gnothangnothachan ri ach posposasdh a dhean
ainns air spot a rainig am ban
righ EEireann – Ach nuair chuid sidsiod na
beacbeachd se cha dean i idir idir e
agus nach fac i duine riamh
roimhe ach gus a rorobh ach an
sean teac. ach an colan a
bha sin a thaine ga h-iarrh-iarraidh i
fhein Cha rorobh fios aig air farun

add.p:
agus tha aobar do mhna s do
leannan agadsa slan fallain
Tionnaich an nis a bhail a (sea)
ors an Righ gus am faigh mise
greim oirre. Thionnaich e sin
a bhaile (muir) agus bha iasdan
marbh nan triuir eir a mhachaire
lom sgiamhach. Chruinnich a chuid
eacchuideachd a sin tiomaicheal orrasan.

Dh-feoraichDh-fheoraich iad de dheanadh iad
riuriutha. Se ordan a thug an Righ aon
sloc a dheanamh agus an cuir
ann colacomhla. Rinneadh sin agus
bha ise (Deirdire) na suisuidh eir bruaich
an t-sluic agus i sireadh a dhean
amh farsuinn. Nuair bha an

div.p:
no gniomh boirboireannaich agus cha mhumhutha
b'urra dhidhith suidhe cant ann air
ais a sheur chair) le cion s nach
fac i dad do dhainedhaoine riamh. Ach
thuirt i ris nad tugtugadh e dail lalatha us
blianbliadhna dhidhith gum bith e fad na chom~chomain
Thuirt e gum deandeanadh e sidsiod ach ise
dheardhearbhadh cinncinnteach laidir posposadh ris agus
gum cuir e boirboireannaich agus fir a thoirt
faolumfaoghlum us ionionnsachadh laimhe dhidhith.
Bha i sin an teolteoghlach an ririgh agus ghabh
i os lamh na cun. bha an righ a
dear rithe agus bha i so ach lalatha
agus i mach colacomhla ris na boirboireannaich
bha ga h-ionh-ionnsachadh eir a chroc agus de
chunchunnaic i tightighinn ach gum be truir
fhear agus ghabh i nooran
mor an sin diudiubh. Bha i treis
ag amh.ag amharc orra agus mu dheirdheireadh
nuanuair bha easeasan a dludluthachad oirre smaoint

add.p:
agus thuirt e ris Thig thusa agus
beir air mo choise. Rinn e sin
ach cha b-fhada gus an do leig e as
i. Sheall Naoisne an uair sin
agus nuair a chunnaig e gun
rorobh a bhrathreanbhraithrean marbh bha e coma
co dhiudhiubh bhiodh e fhein marbh no
beo agus cha rorobh e fhein fada gus
an tug e fairis s gus an tug e
suas an deo. Dh ebch Duana
gacha Draodh gun d roin easun
mar a dh iarr an Righ agus gun rorobh
clann Uisne eir basachabasachadh A bhean
nacnachd agus a bhuaibhuaidh ag a bhi dhuitsa
ars an Righ cha chall liomsa na
chosd mi riutsa. Ars esun
chuir mise seachad clanclann Uisne

div.p:
i eir ann rud a thuirt an teacaireteachdaire a
thug am fios thun an righ agus smaoinsmaoint
i Deairdire gur h iad truir chlanchlann
Uisne bha sidsiod agus Naoisne agus
na bha os cionn cromadh an da
shlinshlinnein a bhar aig eir fir an t-saoilt-saoghail
Gun do thalantaich gaol an duin
sin na cu agus na b-int agus
gu biach nach rorobh e deondeonach falbh as.
Falbhar i agus thus thruis i cuid
aodaodaich agus falbhfalbhar as an deoideoidh agus
iad a gailgabhail seachseachad eir palas
an ririgh. Chuala dhistdhithist brathbhraithrean mu
dheighndheighinn a bhoirbhoireannaich bha aig ConConochar righ
Ulla agus smaoinsmaoinich iad nam faicfaiceadh
Naoisne am brathair i gur h ann
bhiodh i aige fhein gu seacseachd araid
on nach rorobh i posdposda aige. O Luath
aichemid ar cas agus greas
amid ar ceum ors Aillean agus

add.p: gu math nach toir e tilleadh orra.

Ars an DruiDruidh FeuchaiFeuchaidh mise
doidoigh eile sin bho nach do chuir sidsiod
stad orra. RothaiRothaidh mi an fhairge
na clachun rōta s cha teid iad
seachad oireoirree. Cha b fhada gus an
d eubh Ardan gu robh e eir toirt fairis
Mata ors Naoisne thug thus agus
suisuidh eir an t-slineint-slinnein eileile agams

Cha rorobh fada sin nuair fhuair
e bas ach gad bha e marbh fhein
cha rorobh NaoisNaoisne a bhrathair ga leig-
eadheil as. Cha b fhada ristrithist gus na
Dh eubh Aillein gu rorobh e fein air toirt
fairis. Nuair a chulachuala Naoisne sin
leig e osna throm ghoirt as uaiuaith

div.add: A Naois from this came AonasAonghas, Angus?
div.p:
moran astair aigaige ri dheandheanamh agus
e an diugh ruith air bhon a tightighinn
as an deideigh. Nuair a luluathaich iad air ais
cas agus a ghreas lasaich iad an ceum
bha iad a dol na b fhaide bh uaipebhuaipe
Agus nuair a chuir Dearidire
so ghlaoglaodh o an guth ard]le ard a cinn A NaosNaoisne
NaosNaoisne an ann a brabrath mismise fhagfhagail tha
thu. Chual NaNaoise tuar binne eir
glaoglaodh agus lauirlabhuir e fhein ri dhistdhithist
bhrabhrathair agus thuirt e Gu de an
glaoghlaodh tha an chluais nach eil
saoirbh dhomh put thoirt ris
Gu de an glaoglaodh tha thu cluicluinntinn ors
Ardan ach geoigeoidh us eunlaieunlaidh
ChonChonachair righ Ulla Ach luamidluathamaid
ar cas agus greasmidgreasamaid ar ceum
agus mor an astair aigaige ri dheandheanamh
a Nuair a luluathaich iad an cas agus
a ghreasghreasaich iad an ceum bha iad

add.p:
an DruiDruidh gus an tig a chuideacchuideachd a
chuir thus eir an son. Chuir an
druidruidh a sin coille rompa tromh
nach b urrainn iad dol. Ghabh Naoisne
sa dha bhrathair troimh an choille
gad bhidh iad i? thighead eile. De ga
math sidsiod ars an Righ cha dean e feum
s cha chum e tilleadh orra. Gut a fiach
aifiachaidh mise cleas eile ni arsa an DruiDruidh
agus chuir e fairge rompa eir
a mhachair. Ruisg an tuinn olach
iad fein agus chuir iad an cuid
aodaich eir culaobh an cinn agus
chuir Naoisne mac Uisne
Deardculire na smodha eadar a dha
shlinein s cha rorobh tilleadh eir an
ceum. Tha mi fhein a faicinn
ars an Righ gad a rinn thu sid

div.p:
a dol na b-fhaid uapen a bha iad
GhlaoGhlaoidh i sar as an ard A NaoisNaoisne
A NaoisNaoisne ann a bia rin fhag thuas
thu 3 uair Chuala NNaoisne an treastreasamh
glaoglaodh Rainig sidsiod mi os cionn
glaoglaodh a chuala duine agus till
mi agus thilthill NaoNaoisne ChomChomhlaich DeDeirdire
agus NaNaoisne a cheile phog
NNaoisne DDeirdire agus phog DDeirdire NaoNaoisne agus
a dhistdhithist bhrabhrathair Dh falbhDh fhalbh NNaoisne mac
Uinse agus thog e DDeirdire a fras ghualghuaille
agus chuir e a casan gach taotaobh
ga mhuinmhuineil a nall air a bhrobhroilleach
agus thuirt e ri bhrabhraithrean iad a chum
ail ceum air agus neo thraing
uair ceum easeasan coiscoiseachd SmaoSmaointich
NNaoisne so nach deandeanadh e math dha
fuirfuireach an EEireann tuille aig mar a chuir
e CConachar Ulla mac bhrathbhrathar athar

add.p:
sin toiseach an lalatha ann. Thuirt Naoisne
gun bu choir dhaibh a bhibhith falbh as
an d-aitd-aite ud fhagail s dol gu Ionar
nis far an rorobh iad an toiseach. Dh-
fhalbh Naoisne mac Uisne Deardire
nieannighean Dholan Chruitire Aillein agus
Ardan a bhrathair nan ceirceithir. ChaiChaidh
a sin brath is staigha-staigh a dh-ionsuidh-ionnsuidh an
Righ gun do dh-falbhdh-fhalbh a cuideaccuideachd eir
an rorobh an toir agus chuir an Righ a
sin fios eir Duanan gacha Draōc
druichi bha aige feinfhein. Is mor an t-or
san storas a chosg mise ri faotunfaotuinn
a thoirt dhusadhutsa ged a tha iad sid eir
falbh an diudiugh gun choramcothram agams
eir an tilleadh. Mata tillitillidh mismise ad ars

div.p:
na aghaghaidh ged nach rorobh e posda ris a'
bhorbhoireannach. Thainig e sin gu ruigruige
Alba agus rainig e Ionar Naois
Rinn e taigh ri taobh amhainn
Nis (Naois) far far am marbhadh
e am bradan a mach air an inisinnis
Thug iad am a sneachsneachd agus bha
iad ann gus an rorobh am aig
CConachar ririgh Ulla am boirboireannach a phosphosadh ann
an ceanceann an lalatha sna blianbliadhna Gu de bha
CConachar ririgh Ulla san am sin ach na
bheacbheachd fhefhein gun tugtugadh e mach DeirDeirdire
bho NaoisNaoisne le chlaidhchlaidheamh as le lann
i bhibhith posposadh no gun a bhibhith aige
Gu de an obair bh aig CConachar ririgh Ulla ach
a cuir na bha do dh airm aig an
EirEireann ach gus lalatha blair us baitebaiteal
a thoirt do NaoNaoisne agus a bhean
a thoirt uaiuaithe gun tainig. Bha
e so a smaoin aige fhein ged

add.p:
thig thu eir an laimhsa dhiom
an nocnochd Cha ghabh mi sin bhuat
ars easun. Is fhearr liom dol
dachaidachaidh agus inseadhinnseadh am m athair
an t-euct-euchd a rinn mi no na bheir
thus dhomhs eir an doigh sin.
Tha Naoisne mac Uisne cho
cairideach dhuit fhein sa tha
e dhomhsa gad tha thu sireadh
a bhais agus sni tu mo bhasa
cuideaccuideachd.

Thill a sin mac og aig FearFearchar
mac Roe gu Naoisne agus thuirt
e ris gun reachadh e gu athair
le brath gun rorobh adsun sabhailte
bho lamhan an Righ Bha an uair

div.p:
a chuirchuireadh e fios eir NaoisNaoisne gu ruig
bra nach tigtigeadh e agus falbhfalbhaidh e agus
cuircuireadh fios gu ruig Fearchar
mac Rōth e dh falbhdh fhalbh a shirshireadh DhDheirdire
gu ruig IonIonar Naois agus gun n cuirm
mor gu bhibhith aca aig palas righ
ConConachair Chuir e fios gu ruig FearFearchar dol
agus brath a thoirt a Naoisne gu
ri coin mhor sholsholasaich gu bhibhith ann
agus e thuice. Nuair a rainig FearFearchar
mac Roth agus a dh-insedh-innse theactheacaireachd
thuirt NaNaoisne An ta tha mi cinncinnteach
nach am gu a cuirm tha ConConachar
a cuir fios orm ach theid sinn
ann. Tha triuir mhac agams
agus iad nan tur ghaisgghaisgeach agus
beud sam bi a thann. G si dheandheanadh
ort seasseasaidh iad san do chuis Agus falbhfalbhaidh
tus an na chuir e ach ort theid
thu fhein na coim agus ma

add.p:
Cha tu theid aann mach ach mise
ars an treas mac aig Fearchar
mac Roe. Sann mun a rinn m athair
or n earsba ma dheiribh ChaChaidh am
fear sin a mach agus cha d fhag
e fear innse sgeoil m airisaithris
an tuaraisgeuil. Dh eubh an Righ
an sin le an guth ard co bha dean
adh ār a measg a dhaoine. Tha
mise ors seasun am mac is oig
aig FearFearchair mac Rōe. Thug mismise
ars an Righ drochaidean saor dha d sheanair dha d athair
dha d bhrathairean agus bheir mi
drochaid shaor dhuitsa fhein ma

div.p:
dh'fhiach CConachar coiread riut fiach
coir ris agus mu dh'fhiach e
gairge riut bith mo thriuir mhac
sa leat. Dh'fhalbh FearFearchair mac Ro agus
dh fhalbh co ris Aillein agus Ardan
agus DeardDeardire agus Naoisne. Cho
lualuath sa chaichaidh iad a so eir tir an
EEireann chuir FearFearchair fios thun ChonChonachair
gun rorobh na daoine iad eir tightighinn eir
tir eir ris na EEireann agus feuch an
nocadhnochdadh e coircoiread us ceartas riu.
Mata ors ConConachar gad a chuir
am brath thuca cha rorobh duil agam
gun tigtigeadh iad cho ealealamh agus chan
eil mi builbuileach deas eir an son. Ach
tha taigh shios ud anns an rorobh mi
cumail amhuisg agus
reachreachadh iad ann agus bith mo
thaigh sa deas eir an lancinn am
mairmaireach An ta ors NaNaoisne on na se

add.p:
mun a rinn m athair ar a earbsa
ChaiChaidh e sin mach agus thug e buadh
buathadh fir gun chul na measg
eir ann feadh agus mharbh leis
da thrian diudiubh Dh euch an Righ a nist
an guth ard Co tha deanamh ār
a measg mo dhaoine. Tha mise
ars mac meadhanach aig Fear
achFearchar mac Roe. An ta thug mi ars
an Righ drochaid shaor dha d shean
air agus drochaid shaor dha d athair
agus bhei mi drochaid shaor
dhuisadhuitsa cuideaccuideachd mu thig thu eir
an lamhse dhion an nocnochd Ma
tha ni mi sin ars easun. ChaiChaidh am fear
ud eir taobh an righ ors Deardire. Theid
mise mach ars Naoisne agus
caisgicaisgidh mi an toractorrachd

div.p:
sin a dh' orddh' ordaich dhuinn theid sinn
ann is cinncinnteach nach ann eir son
caircaireamh tha e gan carcaramh a sin. ChaiChaidh
iad a sios do thaigh eir an leag-
adh sin agus rainig iad taigh
a an amhuisg agus bha coig fichfichead
diag agus coig amhuisg bheag
is staigha-staigh rompa. Cha rorobh h-aon
na dhiu nach d-rinn glaoglaodh mor gaire
nuair chaichaidh na triuir brathbraithrean agus
DearidDeardire is taigha-staigh. Agus rinn NaoNaoisne
Mac Uisne da ghlaoghlaodh mor gaire
Bu mhumhutha na cacha uile. Nuair
fhuair na h-amuisg a chuid airm
chuir iad do droull am fear eir
an dorust agus dh eirdh eirich NNaoisne mac
UUisne agus nuair bha iad ulladh uile
chuir e fhein da dhroull eir
an dorust. Gu de an t-aon
olach a thaigthainig dhachdhachaidh on fam

add.p:
drochaid-shaor do d sheanair ris
drochaid shaor do d-athair agus bheir
mi drochaid shaor dhuit fhein
agus thug eir an lamh so dhions
aidhionnsaidh nocnochd. Mata gabhaigabhaidh mi sin ors easa.
agus ChaiChaidh am fear ud a nunnunn eir taobh
an righ ors Deirdire. Rinn e feum mu
mun d falbhd fhalbh e ars Naoisne. Dh ord
aich an Righ uir eile dhaoine dhol a
sios, a bhean a thoirt a nios agus nach
reachadh a cach a mharbhadh. Thuirt
Deardaire tha tuille cuideaccuideachd a nis a
tighinn agus gaisgeach ars Naoisne
agus caisgidh mi an torractorrachd. Cha
tu theid a mach ach mise ors an dara
mac aig Fearchair mac Roe. Sann

div.p:
do na h-amhh-amhuisg man do chuir thu
da dhroull air an dordorus l De an
t-aon ors easeasan mun do chuir sibh
fhein coig fichfichead diag droull agus coig
droulla diag eir an dordorus mun
reachreachadh cuir sa dha eir InInnsidh mi
sin duit ololaich chan fhac mi riamriamh
a tightighinn thun an na fardfardaich so gun
a b fhearb fhearr a chor rium na thun
fhein no b fhearr a rug greim
dha am feoil na balgam dh am
fuil na tha fhein on ceanceannard nan
amhamhuisg. Ach insinnis fhein a nis
ololaich gu de an t aon mun do chuir
thu fhein da dhroull eir
an dordorus agus nach do chuir sinn
eir ach aonan air fhein
fir mi sin ars NNaoisne nuair lus
chan fhaca mi eir talatalamh nam
beo do shluashluagh coitcoiteann na chord

add.p:
torractorrachd eir tighinn agus gum bith
iad dluth a nis. Thuirt Naoisne
gun reachadh easun a mach
agus gum caisgeadh a n torractorrachd.

Cha tu theid a mach ach mismise
ors am fear bu shine do mhic
Fhearchair mhci Rōe. Sann
mun a dh iarbh m athathir sibhse
gun bheud a leigil oirbh.

ChaiChaidh an gaisgeach sin a mach agus
thoisthoisich e orra agus thuirt an trestreas
cuid air chuideacchuideachd leis. Chunnaig
an Righ so agus dh-eubh e le guguth
ard Co bha deandeanamh ār eor a chuid
daoine? Fhreagair an gaisggaisgeach agus
thuirt e gun rorobh easun a mac
bu shine bh aig FearFearchair mac Rōe
Thuirt an Righ ris – Thug mi

div.p:
cinn na bha cuir as ceart colacomhla
Dh-eirDh-eirich NNaoisne mac UiUisne agus rug e
eir an fhear bu mhumhutha ceanceann agus
bu chaoile cascasan agus mun tainig
ceanceann da uair cha d' fhag e aon
beo dhiudhuibh. Ghlan iad an taigh de
chuirp pe agus thog iad an gealagealbhan
bhan greanachghreadhnach agus bha iad gu
subhabh sol. Ach bha am fear
bha shuas a ga'ailgabhail mulaid nach
rorobh fios a tightighinn a nios ciamar bha
dol daibh an taigh nan Amhaisg
Falbh thus a sios a mhuime ars
Conachar agus faic am bheil DearDeardire
mar bha i nuair dh-falbhdh-fhalbh i uam
sa agus ma tha bheir mis mach
i mar thaothaobh ain an EEireann agus
mar bheil chao l creid no
gnothach ri ChaiChaidh a chailchailleach
sios agus cha rorobh doidoigh eir an sealsealltainn

add.p:
Dh falbhDh fhalbh e an uair sin gu Conachar
Righ Eirinn Ullan. Dh-fheoraich (Conachar)
an righ dheth ciod a bha tighinn ris. ThuirstThuirt
e gun do chuir Naoisne mac Uisne
te de na disnean a bh aig eir a bhord
troimh toll na comhlaicomhlaidh roimh shuil
a mach eir cul a chinn. Ach be mo
thoil sealltainn oireoirre leis an t-suil eile
gad bha mi ch ocraiteach sa bha mi
mar b'e chabhag a chuir sibh orm.

Is fiorIs fhior sud ors an Righ. Reachadh
da cheud treun ghaisgeach da
cheud lan ghaisgeach agus da
cheud luth ghaisgeach agus thug
adh iad a nuas (nīos) thugthugadh anns i
(Deirdire) beo slan agus marbhadh iad
cacha. Thuirt DeirdirDeirdire gun rorobh an

div.p:
is taigha-staigh ach aon toll beagbigein bha eir
a cholcomhla. Sheall a chailchailleach is taigha-staigh
eir an toll bigire agus thill i eir ais
Seadh a chailchaillich ciamar tha
i seo. Tha bhuil orra gur h ann
eir faochagun agus bairnich
So a bha i eir a beath on dh faldh fhalbh
i – cha mhor a dreach na a
snuagh an diudiubh Chan uilleir liom
dearbhdearbhadh eile bharracbharrachd eir a sin ors
ccailleach mun teid mi ga leigeal seachseachad
Falbh thus a sios a GhealabhanGhealabhain
Ghreaonaich mhic righ LochlainLochlainn
ChaiChaidh an GGealbhlean GGreadhnach a sios gu taigh nan
amhusg. Left off here, on
account of having made an ap-
pointment with Dr MacGillivray
to go out shooting with Dr W. E. Mac
Lellan and to dine at Eoligearry
house in the evening. AAlexanderAArchibaldCCarmichael

add.p:
ChaiChaidh Gealbhan Greonach mac
Righ LochlanLochlann a sios gu taigh nan
amhusg. Sheall e staigh eir toll
bigire a bh' eir a d chomhlaichomhlaidh. Am boir
iornach ris an rorobh ghnothach b' a'aistb' abhaist
dhidhith dhol st na caoran dearga
fala nuair a shealladh duine oireoirre
as an aodanaodann. Sheall Naoise mac
Uisne oireoirre an uair sin agus d dh-
anichdh fhaighnich e gun rorobh cuid eigin a coimh-
eacoimhead oirre. Thug e tarrunn eir aon
do na disneun a bheir a bhord. Bhuail
e eir toll a bhuird e agus chaichaidh e tromh
an toll agus suil an duine bha seall
tuinn us chaichaidh e mach eir cul a chinn i.

lg.l: A mhic mo mhic se thuitthuirt an righ
Oscair a righ nan og fhlath
Chunna mi dealradealradh do lann
Bi n fhuail bhi g amharc do bhuaibhuaidh sa chath
Lean gu dludluth ri cliu do shinsreshinnsre
Sna diobair a bhi mac ádsan
Nuair bu bheo treun mhor na(n) rath
Us Tré-uil athair nan treun laoch
Chuireadh iad gach cath le buaibuaidh
Us bhuadhaicheadh iad cliu gach teugmhail
Mair an sruaibhaisruaibhaibh san dan
Aig Air chuinn eig na baird nan deisean
O Os chuir thusa an treun ainsachainseach
S their tearmud dhan lag lamhach fheoguach
Bi mar bhaine struth reothairt garbh

lg.l: Toirt gleic do naimhnaimhdean na Feinn
Ach bi mac fhanna ghoith sheimh thlathlath shnamh
Bu dhaibh san a shir do chobhair
Mar sin bha Treun-mhor nam buadh
Bha Tre-uil nan ruag an dheirgsan
Bha Fionn na thasg aig an Fhinn
Ga'n dion aineart lucluchd eucair
Nan aobhar shin mo lamh
S le failte reach nan coin
S gheogheobh iad fasgafasgadh us cairideas
Fo sgail dhealanaich mo lann.

div.p:
Heard this 60 years ago from an
old man John MacAonaisMacAonghais (Iain
og mac FhionlaiFhionnlaidh) an Smearcleit
UistUibhist a DDeas. This man had an ex-
traordinary quantity of the best poetry
of OssOssian but despised the
rubbish which goes under that name
Died 40 years ago aged about 90.

Moladh Ghoill le Fionn
le Don'ulDomhnull mac Dho'uilDhomhnuill ic Thearlaich
Mart 21 1867 (Di-daoirn Aird Choinnich)

lg.l: Aird aigne Ghoill fear cog.chogaidh FhinFhinn
Laoch leoin lòin ful. nach tim
Laoch fionn fial is milse gloir
Tha seimh na chul loach aoibhneach mor
Leine na mine 's e is glaine gin gean
Aoide na sgoil
Cha'n eil ri ann ach Goill gu ceol thoirt a dh-Fhionn
Treise nan tonn eir ghaisgghaisgeach grin
Buan min air fhir buaibuaidh choraigchomhraig eir
Leumnach 'sa ghailghabhail eucmhach sa ghanstáir
Fear an deud ghil chaoimh nach tug adhaich
Ann cog righ {chanach lag a lamh
Pronntach sa ghair {consachadh{conathach na threoir
Fiuranta min mileanta mor
Leon eir agh consach na threoir

div.p:
Heard this from the same
old man. Donald Mac Intyre
himself is about 70 or 71.

a chan ud Cuch gu suibh.suibhneach O
DaoghDaoghaire Ciamar tha neo chan
Cul. Tha gu math tha e 'n
trast an deigh taighun a dhean.dheanamh
Gu de an taigh a rinn e ann
a sin ors Con.Conull nach bu mhath
na t-sean aitreabh aosmhor
mhor a bh aig a shinre gu

a bhas no leat fhein – bith mid a
falbh. A chiad choille choinchoinneachadh
ri Clonull bhuain e seacseachd gauid
ur dh ann chaoil bu ruighine
agus shniamh e iad agus chuir
e eir bac ruighe Laogh iad
brisidh tu dhomh a Laoidh

na cairdean bu mhumhutha bh aige
Maoim a Chruadcain agus
a b fhaide a bh eir a taobh sa chogad
agus cha n fha mise ceann eir
amh.amhaich gus an leon mi na seacseachd

lg.l: A Chon.Chonull shealaich nan ceann
Is cint.cinnteachmis gun dhagdhfhag thu d ainaimn
Na cuir sin a thargad eir ghad
An slointear leat eir fad na s suinnsoinn
A nieannighean shoirbheartach nan each
Ainnir og nam briarabriathraibh binn
An eirig Chu-chullain nan cleas
Thugadh liom fo dheas na cinn
Co e an ceann molach donn mor
Is deirge nan ros a ghruaighruaidh ghlan
Chuir thu thall eir a thaobh chli
A Chon.Chonull mhoir is ailliaillidh dreach?
U Maoire foiribhneachfoireabhartach nan each
Macan le'n creachte gach cuan
S gar mi dheasun fhein an ceann
S ann liom fhein a thuit a shluagh
A Chon.Chonull mhoir le d ghaisgeadh righ
Co ae an ceann eile eir dhiol chaich?
Fhalt or-bhuior-bhuidh eir dhealradh grinn
Gu mol.mollach sliom mar airigiod ban
Mac a luthaidh o ros ruadh
Mac na h-uaileh-uaisle thuit le m neart
Mo dhoidhoigh gur h-e sidsiod fhein a cheann
Aird righ Lochlan nan lann breac
Co an da cheann so t heir a lamh chli
B ailliaillidh lilibhse 's chan olcmheasa an dealbh
A Chon.Chonull mhoir led ghaisge righ
Is cinnt.cinnteach mi gun dhearg thu d-airm
Cumhal augs Conull cruaicruaidh
DistDithist bheireadh buaibuaidh san leirg
Thugadh lioms an cinn fo dheas
S Gun dh fhag mi an cuirp fon aon leirg
Co 'n da cheann so eir a lamh dheis
A Chon.Chonull nan cleasun an aigh
Aon dath eir falbha nam fear
Os meirig bean ga bheil am baigh
Cheann Mhanuis us Bhuinnrigh mhoir
Se mo dhoidhoigh gur h eud a th ann
Aca fhuaradh ceann a Choin
Eir maogh Thean'righ nan struth seimh
Co a an ceanceann ard chithean thall
Is fhalt fann gu molach sliom
A rasg mar fheur sa dheud mar bhlath
Is ailliaillidh na cacha cruth a chinn
Mac mo pheathar o'n tur sheimh
Sgár mi fhin a cheann o chorp
Suuarach an onair mhic ririgh
Iomachair gu min eir an fhalt
Co na sia cinn a chithean thall
A chuir thu dhiort an taotaobh ma thuathuath
Is guirm aogasg sas caoins rasg
Is duighe falt a Chon.Chonull chruaichruaidh
Seisear bhrathrean a bh ann
Sid iad thall san clab ri gaoigaoith
Clann Challadair nan cleas
Dreum nach rorobh eir leas mo ghaoil
CeanCeann eir fhichead s fichfichead ciad
Gun iomaradh eir fear creuccreuchd no lot
Do chlann mhithiumhaithibh 's mhacumhacaibh ririgh
Thuit an eirig ceann a Chóin.

Tha 'n cuntan righ dogu arach ail
Leigh. iad letrom is sgrios

S cha gheil dhut sluasluagh Ise-fail
Ise-fail = Hebrides. sean.seanchaidh

On nach fhaigh dha ma righ

Gun thion,thionndaidh i riuriutha a cul

Cuir distdithist eir gach taotaobh mad sgēth
Thoirt leat an cath fearail eile

Cuir sidsiod eir do ghulain deis

Buin leat cath fearghala na Firinn
Clanna Morna na mor chli

Ceann ririgh LochLochlainn nan sgiasgiath donn
Cha dachaidachaidh as o fha'orfhaobhar arm
So choragchomhrag le maoim nan treud

lg.l: LaLatha dhan rorobh sinn uile an FhFheinn

Air sliabh Sheal-matha nan
struth dian
Chuir.Chuireadh teacteachdaire eir raon.
B i sin an niannighean bu ghlain snuasnuadh
Bu ghile s bu deirg gnuaignuaidh
Bha da rasg aluinaluinn na ceann
Si g amh.amharc gu falachaifalachaidh ma tiom.tiomchioll
Mu crios ga adh.adhladh caoin curaicuraidh
Chuir i comairig eir an Fheinn
S air Goll muirneach caomh mac Morna
Mar sin s eir Oscar an aigh
Deas lamh a chaisg gach teugmhail
Mo chomairig oirbhse Fhianta math.
Dh eirich Fionn fein na coir
S nighein donn bhoisgheal narach.
Follain nan ann dearg is ailliaillidh

Mac oighre righ na h Easpaine
Spain ard = Spain
Dh eirich ceararceathrar mac Fhinn gu baoth
Na 'n ceithir ranna ruaruadh an domhain
SuiSuidh thus a so cu mo sga 's or s Fionn
A Chun.Chunnacas am fear mor bhuainn
A teacteachd gu cala oirnn as a chuan
Sa toirt ga 'r ionionnsuidh le anamin
Mar illibhin aillibhin nan creag
Mar stuaghanan aine'asachainmheasach thugainthugainn
Mar chaoire teinteach gu cladach
Bha seic an t-srol bhuibhuidh man fhear
Luireach mhor usgrach uallach
Sa dha shleagh nan cuilg ri ghuailean
ClaiClaidheamh mor froiseach nimhe
SgiaSgiath fhineal or bhuibhuidh le m briste blar
Eir dorn toisgeul an laoich mhillimhillidh
Thug e ruathar fir gum cheilcheill.
Leum a shaighead le shar bheacbheachd
S gun leon e le laimh an nieannighean.
Thug e an aire gu dura dana
Eir an a oglaoch mhor a thainig.

div.p:
The rest of this is written.
Fionn had a law that if any
of his heroes took out a woman
who loved him by the might of his
sword that neither her father
nor her pursuer had a right
to her but the hero by whom she
was rescued. Thus many
of the handsomest of women
became wives among the Feinn.

Dan Mhic Righ Sorach

p.title: EoanEoghan Og BhalaiBhalaidh agus EoanEoghan Og Hosta
p.name: Calum MacLeoid
Loch nam madadh

div.p:
Tha gleann os cionn Hosta troimh
am b aistb abhaist do dhaoine bhi dol gus
an Taobh-an-iar. Troimh an ghleann
so tha Amhain SalaiSalaidh a ruith.

Bha droch cuchu garg aig EoanEoghan
og Hosta a bhiodh ann sas anns
gach duine bhiodh a dol seachad.
Bha EoanEoghan og BhalaiBhalaidh a tighinn
dachaidachaidh a Eaglais Chill a Mhoire
feasgar Domhnach agus thug
an cu ga ionsuiionnsuidhagus chuir EoanEoghan
ag an ceann an chu leis a
chlaichlaidheamh anns an ghleann. Bha
EoanEoghan og Hosta na dhuine
laidir borb agus tairnear a
chlaichaidheamh gu EoanEoghan og BhalaiBhalaidh. Thionn
daiThionndaidh EoanEoghan og BhalaiBhalaidh ris agus thois
ich na laoich eir a cheile. Mharbh
EoanEoghan og BhalaiBhalaidh EoanEoghan og Hosta.

Bha nieannighean EoainEoghain oig Hosta a
mach ris an eadradh a bleoanbleoghan
a chruichruidh sa ghleann feasgar
an Domhnaich. Nuair a
chunnaig EEoghan og BhalBhalaidh gun
do mharbh e am fear eile gabhaigabhaidh
sgreanadh agus gabhaigabhaidh a sios
an gleangleann romh n chrodh. Bha
an nieannighean fo bho san am agus thug
a bho leum aiste eir muin na
h-ighne leis an sgoinn a ghabh i.
Dia leat E.Eoghain oig Bhal.Bhalaidh ors an nieannighean
An ta bhronag nan robh fhios agad
mar thachair chan abraabradh tu sin.
Shin e as. agus chaichaidh e fo
choill. Bha duine tieantighinn thuige
le biadh a chuile lalatha s oicheoidhche agus
bha am fear so toirt fios thuige
gach ni mar bha dol san du'aichduthaich.
Bha niannighean do dh E.Eoghan og Hosta
ri bhi posadh aig fear Phaibles
gearraiPhaiblesgearraidh an dara Domhn
ach an deideigh ga h-athair tuit.stuiteam

Cha ghabhadh fear Phaible-sgear
raiPhaible-sgearraidh an niannighean air so – Bha e rath
gum bu tamailteach leis niannighean
fir a thuit mar a thuit a h-
athair a phosadh. Rinn e reit.reiteach
ri te eile agus bha e ri posadh
ririthe. Thainig DomhDomhnach a phosaiphosaidh
agus thug E Beagan oicheanoidhchean
roimh sin chaichaidh EEoghan og Bhal.Bhalaidh
gu taotaobh leaba niannighean EEoghain oig Hosta
agus dh fheordh fheoraich e dhidhith an rorobh an
sgeul fior gun rorobh fear PaibPaiblesgearraidh
ga treisgintreisginn agus dol phosphosadh te
eile. Thuirt ise gun rorobh. Sgead
aich thus thu fhein gu math
Didomhnaich so tiantighinn agus
theirig a Chillamhoire agus
bithidh mise sin. Thainig
Domhnach a phosphosaidh agus an deideigh
a chuile duine dhol istaigh chaichaidh
EoanEoghan og Hosta is taigha-staigh agus shuishuidh
e aig an dorust. Nuair bha crioch
eir an t-searman agus an sluasluagh
gu sgaoilsgaoileadh dh'eirich easan na
sheassheasamh le chlaichaidheamh ruiste na laimh
agus bhoid e eir talamh us athar
nach reach reachreachadh ceann eir
amhaich a mach as a sidsiod gus
am posadh Fear PhaiblesgearraiPhaiblesgearraidh
niannighean EoinEoghain oig Hosta. Ga bu leisg
b eudar so a dheanamh. Nuair bha
am posadh seachseachad shin EoanEoghan og
aiste agus thug e fo choill eir
far an ro e roimhe. Cha rorobh e fadfada
gus an tainig e dhachdhachaidh agus cha do
chuirchuireadh dragh tuille eir.
div.add:
Bha piuthar athair do Chalum
MacLeoid – seanachaiseanachaidh – post
aig EachunEachunn mac Chaluim mhic
EoainEoghain oig Hosta.
Alastair.

div.p:
Mor nan Ceann – U-i-nesasain Naonisein
Here burying place 3029x11 Caibeal in which
buried falenfallen down. Here and there 2x3 feet
of the wall up. Wall generally small boulders
imbedded in lime as hard as themselves.
Lime made from shells. All around
this once a buryburying place. Now a rabbit
warren. Place an island at high water
and at low forms part of the
Island of Watersay at the SSouth EEast end
of which it lies. Green island –
Sandy and rocky. Underground
houses under the caibeal. The caibcaibeal
stands on a knoll. The openings go

No rat or mouse was ever
seen in Pab.Pabbay till the prepreventative man
went there. If a rat or mouse
was brotbrought to it it died immimmediately on touchtouching
its soil and if ever the soil or sand
of PabPabbay was brotbrought to another place not
a rat or mouse was ever seen there
again. It is said that no enemy
would ever put foot on PabyPabbay It
was inter.d him by a fairfairy accouchaccoucheur
who came there to deliver the wife

Mac Ivor was the man on

no mouse nor enemy of any

I have been speakspeaking to the man who

There is a circle over the cave as

It is called Cearcal-Teinteanach
The coruscations of the sea flash

like sparks of fire flying from the
circle.

The Light house stands in some disdistance
from the jutting point. The sea washes
up against the perpenperpendicular rocks of 700 ftfeet
and wets the people in LLighthouse contcontinually. Such
terrific sea as rises here is never
perhaps seen an equal esles whereelsewhere
on the BritBritish coast. A green square
island which lies in the sound be
tween BerBernary and MiulayMingulay and which standstands
about 100 ft.feet high. Sometimes the sea washwashes
clean over it. In summer a few sheep
are sent to graze there. The sheep have
been known to have been swept clean
off by one wave. Several large squsquare
stones at the lower end of BearBearnary were mar
at marked at the request of the HonHonorable
ComCommander of NNational LLighthouses Some of these blocks weigh
80 tons. They were knocked about on
the rocky ledges as if they were
chips of wood. One – the largest – was
tossed up the ledge 12 or 14 feet. These stones
are at high water mark. Another large stone
of 3 tons lay at the bottom of a perperpendicular rock 60 feet
high. The sea pitched it up over this rock
and some distance inland. Decked smacks
fishing on sgriob bhan about miles due
west of BBarra HHead have been known to have their whole
deck covered with beautbeautiful pure white sand in 30
and 20 fathoms in heavy seas. A few years
ago a steamsteamship was passpassing throthrough the PentPentland Firth durduring
a storm and an adveradverse tide. In 75 fathfathoms a territerrible
wave broke over he bow sweepsweeping the deck and
smashsmashed everything the bulbulwark before it and leaving their
stones of cousecourse size behind it.

Fairies A man lived at Allasd
Allasdal in BBarra has alwalways been famous for its
fairfairies. (There are some in underground house there
TheA pudec. of the poor tenttenantry had to leave on acaccount
of the intruintrusion of these. A fairfairy woman had set her heart
up get her for herself and wherever he was and
at any time he had too meet her – Her charm
was irrestible. buthbut he was advised by a wise
old man to leave the country and sell everything
had had nor leave as much as one articlarticle behind him
He did so and emigemigrated to America. UnforUnfortunately he
had an a small old harrow in the back door of his kiln
barn. The woman was still troubltroubling him in AmAmerica and
he wrote begbegging his funds to dispdispose of this. This
was done and the beautbeautifully fairy ceased to trouble him in
times

A wom.woman lived at who had a child. The
child was not growing a bit in fact it was a small
wizened old fashioned child not that my care
and attattention was best upon it. One day the mother
left home and left the child in bed with in to an
old man within to watch the child should be with
The child wakened and got up and made a basin
of fuarag – cream and meal – for him self and
went to bed like a sensenile man

Fulling at Miulay. Heard a fulling song
sung while pas.passing a hut and went in. Found
six good looking comely girls waulking cloth
One sung the verses the rest the chorus
and all took their turn at this. All the
songs suited the body made in ful.fulling and all
to my ear wild weird and beautiful.
One was a fairy song and fairy like.
Measured the arms of two of the girls. Each
meas.measured 11½ inches in circcircumference The rest seemed
to be genallygenerally stout and yet they did not
seem to me to be any supsuperfluous flesh about them.

The ful.fulling song com.commences first slowly and mamajestically
and all keep time to this in their mov.movements.
Then it becomes 'fast and fun till the
whole as by have feel a difdifficulty in restr.restraining
their proppropriety. The cloth is sent round
with the sun. upon no acaccount would they
attempt the conconverse. The cleith luailuaidh is a
a plank a fair ininch thick 1½ brobroad & 10 ffeet long.
It must have been tossed ababout in the AtAtlantic for
a time for it is perforpeforated all over by teredo

One of the songs sung was a compcomposition one
made to myselfthe Stranger all the rest sung the chorus.
I asked them to sing the fairy song again
They hesi.hesitated and when I pressed them they
said that did they repeat a song twice
at a cleicleith luailuaidh they the cloth would
become as thin as before and insinstantly lose
all its colcolour and become pure white!
I did not then press.

My friend old Ruary asked me if I would
come to see a sickly woman. I told him
that I knew nothing of medimedicine. He repreplied my sensentiment that
a sick person felt con.consoled by a perperson asking.
I went. The whole roof of the house
like sever.several others in the colony had been
taken in in spring for manmanure. There was
but one bed and barely enough to cover this
of the roof had been left. The sick perperson a
comely young woman was perfperfectly pros.prostrate not a
hand nor foot could she move. Her
joints hands knees and feet were swolenswollen
greatgreatly on with excrucexcruciating shooting pains. RheumRheumatism.
I adasked the hus.husband to get the hohouse roof in. He said
that the weathweather was so bea.beautifully warm that he
could not realize that his wife had caught
cold from the open house roof.
I remindreminded him of Fionn's saysaying GaoGaoth
romh tholl gaogaoth fo sheol us gaogaoth bharra
nan tonn' s i

About 300 years ago ten fam families lived in MiulayMingulay
One time in winwinter the MacNeil of the day wonwondered that he was seeseeing no perperson from MiuMingulay. He sent a boats crew
to inginvestigate. The boat came over and landlanded and sent
up a man the name of MacPhie. When he came
to the houses which then stood on a rocky Bun
N.North E.East of the pre.present village he found all within dead. He
retreturned to his comcompanions who were keepkeeping the boat. They asasked
him what news. I'll tell that prepresently said Mac
Phi not a bone of your bonebody shall come
in till you tell us first. Has he would
not do so the boat left him and retreturned to CasCastlebay
and told MacN.MacNeil For 7 wweeks no other boat was
able to come. In the meanmeantime MacMacPhie went to the
hill opopposite BearnBearnary where there was a hut where
the sheep sheltsheltered durduring snow. He got hold
of some sheep skin and made a covcovering
for himself and used the fat of the sheep
when frozen as food. When MacNMacNeil came fire
was set to all the huts and the dead bodbodies were
burnt. MacNMacNeil asked MacPhMacPhie if he were
commcommitted and live in MiulMingulay. He said he woldwould
and chose 3 or 4 trusttrusted friefriends. They built the
huts down at the on the stranstrand but from
this the predpredecessors of the pnpopulation had to remove
on accaccount of the enencroachment of the sea. Ruary saw
a man to whose house the sea was
ap.approaching. He left his old mothmother in his hut and
had not got six ydsyards from the hohouse when a a
sea came and left not one stone.

Seumas Sasunnach heard

was kindled against the muime
He went to Skye and who shdshould
meet him but his muime
Mo chiall s mo ghradh
said she. How ill you
must be said he. I never
was better. That can not
pospossibly be said he while your
tuar is so wretched. Put
out your tongue till I see its
appappearance. She did so. He cut
off the point of it with his
knife. There now said
he go and make a song
about me again to affront
me.

Incident in LangaiLangaid – bird life. A LangLangaid came
with a siolag and herring and left these with its
peite and left. Another came with the same
to its own peite which was young. The big
pet did not conconsume what was given it and the
parent bird of the little pet with {went over
and took the siolsiolag and the herherring of over to its own pet
and left. The parparent bird of the big pet rereturned and
founfound that its pet had nothing. The pet and
bird chattered for a moment wher after
which the paparent bird went over to the small pet
took it up in its bill gave it a fierce shake
and threw it with the preprecipice! An old womwoman
in MiulayMingulay has a pet gull 7 yeyears It goes amamong
all the househouses in the place will can ununderstand
all said to it – and do what is said to it.

Creag na h-aonaig and Biola creag

Na Druinnich were the peo who built all
the duns in these isleisles. They were their place
of defence against the attacks of the Loch
lannaich. Crofts are on the southrensouthern

To me it was a gloriglorioussight. The mountmountainous

For some hun.hundred feet outward from the base
of the rock the sea churned purely white against
the rocks like driven snow on a mountsidemountainside
The rocks in caverns and chasms and
gulliegullies here sheerly perperpendicular there in shelves very much
full of birds and there a green spot of grass near
which no birds ever goes. The birds in thousthousands nay
in millions fly hither and thither at times
darkningdarkening the very air and along with
the dizzy height on which you sit makes
making you still more dizzy till
you feel your position anything but safe
or prudent. To my thinking there
is nothing grander in Nature than the
warring of the elements. A wave comes
rol.rolling along and then along. It had its
birth on the icy
Gonnamaol. Passage thro.through Three caiseir
neimhe jammed together. PassPassage feet long.
large enentrancefor a boat & oars to go throthrough
Height 100 feet of arch. The whole horihorizon

layers 100 feet thick there 1 foot. Here hori-
zontal there by its side perperpendicular. Here a curve
like the croupe of a sadsaddle and there
Here a convex and there a concave.

Crois-Ch-ChilleCrois-Chaluim-Chille about 3½ feet squasqaure and the
same in height. At one side a large mamassive
square block of stone and this was the altar.
Leab-a-chrāidh, far am biodh Cal.Calum
Cille ri urnaigh. The other is – the large
one – was his sleeping bed. Twas at this is
time C-CilleCalum-Cille consecrated the burygburying
place. Tobar C-ChilleChaluim-Chille just
below this. It is a small scooped basin in the rock like
a font. It must have been a font as
there is no water to or from it.

Bean.Beannach Naomh Moire wa font also
of this name. The stone in the font was al.always
kept in the font. It was used for to cure pains
and grips.

Cladh Chriosd. There is a stone here
and a cross cut upon it. and B-N-MoireBeannaich-Naomh-Moire
The hut in which the bishop dwelt was
very small. There was a square stone at
one end on which he rested his book. LatterLatterly
people used to put into the hut young
cattle but never one of them came out
alive.

Carradh in BearnBearnary had some
writing upon it. No perperson was ever able
to read the rude letters but one
priest who was here. Mr Ailein – Don-
ullachDomhnullach. He could speak in 12 langlanguages A crew of fishmenfishermen were one
day in BernBernaray. They could not get
out to fish so they began to amuse themthemselves
by shaking the carradh pillar to &
fro. They threw it down and over
the pre.precipice and the pillar which stood
the storm of ages was broken in three "halves"
"tri blaighean."

Fear Bhaothasdail eir
Iain og. Thug a DhunDhun Eideann e air

ri chrochchrochadh. Bha Iain og na

Peats are bad in Miu.Miughlalaidh and scarce. They are
simp.simply the surface soil cut off the rocks a di
sadvantage in many ways. I ob.observred several
stacks of peats within a few ydsyards of the edge of Biola
Creag. a dandangerous place for people to be working. The
Bearnara people cut their peat in MiuMiughalaidh
In Miu.Miughalaidh the peopeople build round with stones as they
do in St Kilda.

Ruary an Ruma. Strange. The school-
servant gave him a cup of tea. He de
clared that once and but once only
did he ever taste tea before. Is there
another man of 88 in Britain who can
say the same? I asked him how did
he like the tea. M anamsa Dhia gu
bheil egle mhath. Ach bu cho mhath
liom an siucar eir uisge teth ris
a so! Nach bu mhath luidh mhic
Righ BreiteanBhreitean seach an seo? Amen.

div.title: Mac Ic AlleinAilein
div.p:
Ghoid fear bo eir Mac Ic AlleinAilein agus
thug Mac Ic AlAllein binn a chrochaichrochaidh
a mach. Chuir a suas eir a chroch
am meirleach. Shir e tiota dail
a leigeil dha. Thug so dha agus
sheinn e mar a leanas.

Nuair chuir chuir am meirmeirleach

Ic Ailein a ghearghearradh a nuas agus

Bha nieannighean mhic Gill sheathain
dhu DhuairtDhubhairt posd aig Mac Neil
Bha i moralach borb. OicheOidhche bha
sin thug i tair mhor a Mhac Neil
agus bhuilbhuail e i agus leig e fuil mu
DhuairtDhubhairt cha rorobh chrichridh agad sidsiod
a dheandheanamh. Cha tuirt e guth. Ach
an ceann tri lathin thuirt e nach
fhearr dhuinn dol a choimhchoimhead d athathair
s do bhrathirbhrathairir. Is mi tha deondeonach
orors ise. Rainig i Duairt.Dubhairt An oichoidhch
sin bha aig a bhord mhor an
DuartDubhairt (fhuair iad lamh sgaoilt
a rompa an DuDubhairt) bhuilbhuail Mac Neil
a bhantbhaintighearna. Leum So nis
ors easeasan. thuirt thu &c. Leum a
brathbraithrean air an cois gu bhibhith aig Mac
Neil. Dean.Deanamh suidhe deandeanamh suidh
gu h-eal.h-ealamh ors MacGillMacGilleathain
cha leibh i ach leis fhein. Bha
le Bha Mac N.Neil agus a bhean a
tilltilleadh dhachdhachaidh agus ann an Caoil
Muile ris an abrar Sgodag.
Dh iarr ise dol air tir a bhuain
bad duilisg. Chaidheas air tir agus
ghabh MacNeil mu cuairt an
sgeir agus falbhar us fagar ise
sid. Bhathaidh air an sgeir i.

ChunnChunnaic niannighean RiRigh na SpaineSpainne
ann an aislig MacGillMacGilleathain Dhu.Dhubhairt
agus chuir i roimpe gun siulsiubhail
i an saoghallsaoghal gus am faighfaigheadh i cait
air bith am bith e. Thainig an long
aic agus tog do dh ann u ni. gu
DuairtDubhairt. Co chaichaidh air bord ach gum
b e MacGillMacGilleathain Co luath sa chunchunnaic i e
thug i sios an chaibchaibin e. Bhuail
iad eir oilol s air gailgabhail bithidbithidh. An e
so ars ise do thiotle – Muile an
eilean so? S i ors easeasan. A ors ise
is suarsuarach an tidt so do dhuin coir
sam bith. O dh' foin.dh'fhognadh i dh am
athathair s dh am sheansheanair agus fonifoghnaidh i
dhomh. San is fhearfhearr dhut falvfalbh
colacomhla rium fhin us gheogheobh thu bhi d ri
air an SpainSpainn. M am fhifhin nuair
chualchuala MacGill.MacGilleathain so nach rorobh e fad
an aghaghaidh a ghnothghnothaich idir. Shriod an
te bha air tir gun donas air choireigchoireigin
bha air toir MhicGillMhicGhilleathain gus thainig
i macmach gu long niannighean ririgh na SpSpainne
Cha d fhiach le dol air bord bu ach chuir
i fios eir MacGill.MacGilleathain. Thuirt i ri giullan
beag bha eir bodbord e chur match
ri te dhan na togtogsaidean fudair eir bord
agus gun tug i fhein dha na chuir
e fhad sa bi bheo i. Fhuair i MacGillMacGilleathain an sgoth agus an giulgiullan
agus chaichaidh iad gu tir. Cha b fhada
gus an cualas am bom fire agus ans
long ninighean RiRigh na SpSpainne na mirean san
speur. Thilg leth an t soithsoitich
gu Caol rethe agus chailchaill an leth
eileile suas Dunan Fionn!

Nuair chunnchunnaic MacGillMacGilleathain
gun do chuir a bhean ninighean RRigh na SpaiSpainne
a dhidhith eir chaichaidh e mach lalatha ghailghabhail
sail leleithe agus fagar air sgeir McLean
i aig cannceann Sliosmore. Thill
MacGillMacGilleathain dach.dachaidh agus e 'n duil gun
do bhathbhathadh a bhain.bhaintighearna De ach a bha
co-hdalta do'n bhain.bhaintighearna a bu ach. air
ceann Sliosmoire agus chunchunnaic
e ise ag eubhach agus chuir
e mach sgoth agus thug e gu tir i
agus chaichaidh e dhachdhachaidh leleithe do dh Ile
thun a h-athar. Chuir MacGill.MacGilleathain
a sin fios a dh Ile thun an TighTighearna
IlechIleach gu robh a nieannighean gun duil rith
aig a bhas. Chuir an TighTighearna IIleach fios
air ais nach rorobh arach air ach
na b e thoil e e chuir a cuirp ga
thuige fhein a dh-Ile. Rinn e so
Rainig e Ile. Dol is is taigha-staigh thun
a chladchladh bha bratbratach dhughdhubh ris na
croinn aig agus e fo bhroin
us mulad. Rinn.Rinneadh an tor.torradh. Aig
an dintir an deigh an tor.torraidh dh fhagdh fhagadh
ait air taotaobh eile bhuird mu choinchoinneamh
MhicGill.MhicGilleathain Co thain.thainig agus a
shuidh a so ach gum bi bhean
fhein. Sheall MacGillMacGilleathain mar gum
bith duin a cheall ann. Leum
e air a chois agus le aon leum
bha e far an bhuird sa mach
an dorust. Thilg brod. us claiclaidheamh
as a dheidheigh us chaichaidh iad ro a cholacholann
Rainig e an long fhada agus fhuair
e dhachdhachaidh gu Du.Dubhaird mun rug iad air.

Bha distdithist ghillean nan compcompanaich aig a cheile
Bhite g aire chlaidh an uair sin. ThurtThuirt
an dara fear ris an fhear eil ga be fear
bu luaith gheogheobh am bas gun reachreachadh am
fear eile ga aire. ChaChaidh fear dhiudhiubh null
thairis agus thug e fich.fichead bliannabliadhna thall
Nuair thill e dhachdhachaidh bha chompchompanach
marbh agus chuimhchuimhnich e air a gheall
bha eatora agus chaichaidh e ga aire air
chladh. Bha e g aire chlaidh anns
a Chroc Maireanteich. agus chunchunnaic
e moran sluaisluaigh a tightighinn agus a chuile
h-uaih-uaig bha sa chladh a fosg.fosgladh. Ghabh
an sluasluagh dhan uaighean fhein –
na fichfichead dhiudhiubh dol sa chuile h-uaih-uaigh –
Chun.Chunnaic e sin te tigh.tighinn air deir.deireadh agus i
ann tuarail bocbochd s gun aic ach i
fhein. BhruithBhruitheann easun (I asked
who spoke firtfirst. Ruary in astonishastonishment
he to be sure – Cha bhruithbhruitheann duine fon
an t-saoghail uiluile am feasd gun
am bruithbruitheann ris.) Gu de ars easeasan chuir
thus cho fad so air dheirdheireadh FadFadachd
mo dhaoine s mo chuidchuideachd uam.
Nach cuala thu iomiomradh air ninighean RiRigh
na SpaineSpainne bhath am Bagh DhuDhubhaird
Is mise is sin agus tha na h-
usgraichean oir bha mam lamh
an lon a mullach na sgeir iad ud
Bheir thusthusa as iad ars ise agus falfalbhaidh
tu agus togaitogaidh tu mo chnamhchnamhan
as a so agus bheir thu mo chnamhchnamhan
gus a ruig an SpainSpainn agus cha

The last of the Lochlannaich lived in
FudaFuday and were killed there. They were
killed by Mac an Amharais. He was a
an illegillegitimate son of MacNeil – disowned
by his father, hence the name. Mac
Neil at last said to him. If thou
be my son go and kill a ghraisg ud
am FudaFudaidh. He went and left none
of them living. The Lochlannaich
at one time owned all these islands
A son of the King of LLochlann whose name
was Barp and who was the embodiembodiment
of all that was fierce and cruel
and murderous died. He was buried
behind Bailenacreaige and all
all the Loch.Lochlannaich in all the islands colcollected
and piled stones over him for fear he
should rise again to be a scourge
upon them. This was the origin
of "Dun a Bhairp" in Barra.

The notorious Capt Scott came
to MiulayMingulay after Culloden. He got hold
of a man there Iain Mac Fhearachair ic Neill who had been in the army
of the Prince and without trial judge
or Jury hanged the man. The man whose
name was Iain Mac Fhear ic MhurMhurchaidh MacNeill
Iain mac Fhearachair ic Mhurachidh ic Neill
was remarkably big and strong. When
his bones are still brotbrought up they all
were large. Capt Scott and his soldiers
caridcarried themthemselves most ferociously. They
amused themthemselves by flaying the cattle
of the people alive and allowing them
then to run mad about the island.
Among the band was a HighHighlander who after
the man was hanged whisperwhispered to the
peoppeople not to touch the body as Scott wouwould
yet return before going into the boat
and would give their houses to the flames
for the simple want of an excuse
The peoppeople took the advice. Scott rereturned
from the strand but the body of the
man was where he left it so Scott
went away. The man had been
living in a cave long previous to this.
> His own brobrother had to shew where he was, sword to his heart
Some time after this a vessel came
and anchoranchored in the bay. All the peopeople
fled thinkthinking that the infamous
Scott had come again. Their
was one old womwoman who was unable
to keep up with the rest. She threw
herself on her knees on the hillside
Leaba Ciaraig and comcommenced praypraying loudloudly and earnearnestly. Her
prayer ran thus. Stoirm us anradh
Stoirm us anraanradh stoirm us anradh
Dh fhuadaicheas a ghraisg on fhearfearann
– beating her breast the while. In the
morning there was a gale and the ship
had to slip her cable and set sail.
She turned out to be a lugger. salt &c.
The MiulayMingulay people strike their breasts
while praypraying and say Mo mhor choire mo mhor
600 soilsoldiers were for 10 days between MiulayMingulay

All was desdestroyed as if the wing of ravage had
